Package kut

Class Bytes

java.lang.Object
kut.Bytes
public class Bytes extends Object
'byte[]' management.

  • Method Details

    • mk

      public static byte[] mk(int len)
      Creates a 'byte[]' of length 'len', intialized with 0's.

      If 'len' < 0, it is set to 0.

      Parameters:
      len - Array size.
      Returns:
      A new array.

    • fromArr

      public static byte[] fromArr(ArrayList<Byte> a)
      Converts an ArrayList to 'byte[]'.
      Parameters:
      a - Array to convert.
      Returns:
      A new array.

    • toArr

      public static ArrayList<Byte> toArr(byte[] bs)
      Converts a 'byte[]' to ArrayList.
      Parameters:
      bs - Array to convert.
      Returns:
      A new array.

    • fromStr

      public static byte[] fromStr(String s)
      Converts a String to 'byte[]' codified in "UTF-8".
      Parameters:
      s - String to convert.
      Returns:
      A new array.

    • toStr

      public static String toStr(byte[] bs)
      Converts a 'byte[]' codified in "UTF-8" to String.
      Parameters:
      bs - Array to convert.
      Returns:
      A new String.

    • add

      public static byte[] add(byte[] bs1, byte[] bs2)
      Adds two 'byte[]'.
      Parameters:
      bs1 - First array.
      bs2 - Second array.
      Returns:
      A new array equals to bs1 + bs2.

    • take

      public static byte[] take(byte[] bs, int n)
      Returns the n first elements of 'bs'.

      If 'len' < 0, it is set to 0.

      If 'len' > bs.length, all the array is returned.

      Parameters:
      bs - Array to truncate.
      n - Bytes to keep in.
      Returns:
      A new array.

    • drop

      public static byte[] drop(byte[] bs, int n)
      Returns the remains elements after removing those witch are returned by 'take'.
      Parameters:
      bs - Array to truncate.
      n - Bytes to remove.
      Returns:
      A new array.
